rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;d04bf391.1501">   <title>Final Call for Papers: Early career stream at Housing Studies Association annual conference </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;d04bf391.1501</link>   <description> Apologies for cross posting...<br><br>HSA CONFERENCE 2015 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdHousing the Generations: Justice, Inequality and the Implications of Political Change\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br>Wednesday 8th- Friday 10th April, University of York, UK<br><br>The call for papers for the Early Career Housing Researcher Stream at this conference closes in ONE WEEK.<br><br>The Early Career Researcher stream represents a vital part of the Housing Studies Association\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds commitment to emerging research communities. It offers early career delegates a supportive forum in which to showcase their work and gain constructive feedback. This long standing stream is well attended by conference delegates. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-23T11:42:50+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ben Pattison</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;d04bf391.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;cf184cb9.1501">   <title>CFP: 'Housing the Generations' - Housing Studies Association Conference 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;cf184cb9.1501</link>   <description> With apologies for cross-posting, please see the call for papers for the<br>interdisciplinary Housing Studies Association conference. The deadline for<br>abstracts is Friday 30th January 2015.<br><br>*Call for Papers: Housing Studies Association Conference 2015*<br><br>*Housing the Generations: Justice, Inequality and the Implications of<br>Political Change*<br><br>*University of York*<br><br>*Wednesday 8th \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Friday 10th April 2015*<br><br>Papers are invited for the Housing Studies Association\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds 2015 conference.<br>The conference offers a welcoming platform for a wide range of topics and<br>disciplines, including (but not limited to) social policy, sociology,<br>economics, planning, critical and human geography, and criminology. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-05T16:34:53+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Tom Moore</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;cf184cb9.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;726ccffc.1412">   <title>New Housing and Well-Being Seminar Bursaries </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;726ccffc.1412</link>   <description> Dear early career researchers,<br><br>We would like to remind you of a one day seminar on Housing and Well-Being on 14th January 2015, at the University of Reading (see attached for more details). This event is being sponsored by the Housing Studies Association. We are now able to offer two Early Career Researcher bursaries of \ufffd\ufffd125 each to cover travel/accommodation to enable those with limited funds to attend the event. If you wish to apply for one of these bursaries please complete the attached form and send it, along with an abstract of about 200 words for a paper you [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-11T11:53:27+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Chris Foye</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;726ccffc.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;45286a00.1412">   <title>Re: CFP: Generation Rent Seminar - Young People\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Housing Options and Future Welfare</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;45286a00.1412</link>   <description> Hi Tom<br><br>Hi<br><br>The Race Equality Foundation is a national charity which seeks to promote<br>race equality in public services. If you'd like us to promote this event,<br>please do submit details using the following form:<br><br>http://better-housing.org.uk/submit-event<br><br>I'll let you know when the event's on the website and will send details out<br>to our 3000+ Twitter followers. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-08T10:08:21+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Kat Clayton</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;45286a00.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;facec563.1412">   <title>Housing and Well-Being </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;facec563.1412</link>   <description> Dear Early Career Researchers,<br><br>This is just a reminder of the five HSA early career bursaries (\ufffd\ufffd50 each) available for those attending the Day Seminar on Housing and Well-Being in Reading. http://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/day-seminar-on-housing-and-well-being-exploring-the-relationship-and-policy-implications-tickets-14160272757 . All tickets have been taken but we have reserved five spaces for bursary recipients. If you are interested in attending please complete the attached form (page 3) and (if you want to) submit an abstract to c.foye@pgr.reading.ac.uk by WEDNESDAY 10th DECEMBER (next week). [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-06T09:52:07+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Chris Foye</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;facec563.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;9bceba76.1412">   <title>CFP: Generation Rent Seminar - Young People\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Housing Options and Future Welfare</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;9bceba76.1412</link>   <description> With apologies for cross-posting, list members may be interested in either<br>attending or presenting at this seminar.The deadline for abstracts is<br>approaching - please note the revised deadline of *Wednesday 17th December.*<br>We welcome a range of disciplinary perspectives on the broad theme of young<br>people's housing options and future welfare.<br><br>*CFP: Deconstructing \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdGeneration Rent\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd: Young People\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Housing Options and<br>Future Welfare* [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-05T23:28:58+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Tom Moore</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;9bceba76.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;1beba675.1412">   <title>Fwd: Right to Rent Checks </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;1beba675.1412</link>   <description> Hi all<br><br>This might be of interest to the list. Please direct any questions to<br>Saira.<br><br>Thanks<br><br>Kat<br><br>Dear All<br><br>As you will be aware MAX has been working on independently evaluating the<br>Right to Rent checks which are being piloted in the West Midlands. The<br>pilot started on Monday 1st December. To this end we are conducting a<br>survey of landlords and tenants. We are delighted that apart from the MAX<br>coalition we have worked with partner organisations to design the contents<br>of the questionnaires namely, Shelter, NUS and the Chartered Institute of<br>Housing. We have also been strongly [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-04T16:11:50+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Kat Clayton</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;1beba675.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;5be91e7f.1412">   <title>CFP: Early Career stream at the 2015 Housing Studies Association conference </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;5be91e7f.1412</link>   <description> Apologies for cross posting...<br><br>HSA CONFERENCE 2015 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdHousing the Generations: Justice, Inequality and the Implications of Political Change\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br>Wednesday 8th- Friday 10th April, University of York, UK<br><br>The call for papers for the Early Career Housing Researcher Stream at this conference is now open.<br><br>The Early Career Researcher stream represents a vital part of the Housing Studies Association\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds commitment to emerging research communities. It offers early career delegates a supportive forum in which to showcase their work and gain constructive feedback. This long standing stream is well attended by conference delegates. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-01T10:10:42+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ben Pattison</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;5be91e7f.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;a29e98f1.1411">   <title>New briefing from the Race Equality Foundation: Ethnicity, health and the private rented sector </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;a29e98f1.1411</link>   <description> *apologies if you receive this more that once- please forward on to<br>interested parties*<br><br>Ethnicity, health and the private rented sector<br>http://www.better-housing.org.uk/briefings/ethnicity-health-and-private-rented-sector<br>The link between poor housing and poor health is well documented and<br>extremely complex, with numerous confounding factors having direct and<br>indirect impacts on both physical and mental health. Evidence shows that<br>homes in the private rented sector in England are in poorer physical<br>condition compared to owner-occupied or social rented sector homes, whilst<br>the recession has led to rising levels of insecurity within the sector,<br>which may also have an impact on the health of residents. While [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-28T15:44:18+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Kat Clayton</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;a29e98f1.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;8c4b20d0.1411">   <title>Fwd: Stop thousands of evictions </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;8c4b20d0.1411</link>   <description> [image: Shelter] &lt;http://email.shelter.org.uk/c/11xGXLbyfaw1uPI8eXujllEP&gt;<br><br>*Don\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt miss this chance to end revenge evictions.*<br><br>As a Shelter helpline adviser, I\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdve heard first-hand how something as<br>simple as reporting a broken shower or asking for a washing machine can<br>lead to eviction and even homelessness.<br><br>What\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds more, I\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdve spoken to renters with collapsing ceilings, exposed<br>wires, severe mould and even mice and flea infestations, who are too afraid<br>to complain in case they\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdre evicted too. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-25T16:35:46+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Kat Clayton</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;8c4b20d0.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;9f3869b8.1411">   <title>Re: Housing and Well-Being Seminar </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;9f3869b8.1411</link>   <description> Hi<br><br>The Race Equality Foundation is a national charity which seeks to promote<br>race equality in public services. If you'd like us to promote this event,<br>please do submit details using the following form:<br><br>http://better-housing.org.uk/submit-event<br><br>I'll let you know when the event's on the website and will send details out<br>to our 2500+ Twitter followers.<br>Thanks<br><br>Kat<br><br>On 25 November 2014 at 08:22, Chris Foye &lt;C.Foye@pgr.reading.ac.uk&gt; wrote: [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-25T09:23:21+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Kat Clayton</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;9f3869b8.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;3fb78f72.1411">   <title>Housing and Well-Being Seminar </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;3fb78f72.1411</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>In case you haven't already heard (apologies if you have), on Wednesday 14th January 2015, there will be a day seminar on &quot;Housing and Well-Being : Exploring the Relationship and Policy Implications&quot;, at Reading University.<br><br>The relationship between housing and well-being embraces housing as a physical object, a signifier of status and the embodiment of 'home'. Funded by the Housing Studies Association, this day seminar will explore this complex relationship, from theory through to policy, touching on both qualitative and quantitative research. It promises to be an informative day with talks from Prof David Clapham, Paul Bradley of [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-25T08:22:58+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Chris Foye</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;3fb78f72.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;56697217.1411">   <title>Tenancies Reform Bill- Shelter campaign to stop revenge evictions. </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;56697217.1411</link>   <description> *Shelter campaign to stop revenge evictions.*<br><br>*What is revenge eviction?*<br>There is currently no protection from eviction for renters who report poor<br>conditions to their landlord or local authority. As a result, over 200,000<br>renters have been evicted or served notice in the past year because they<br>complained to their local council or their landlord about a problem in<br>their home... [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-18T16:45:14+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Kat Clayton</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;56697217.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;5f60829f.1411">   <title>Imaging Homelessness in a City of Care </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;5f60829f.1411</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br><br>For the past two months, we - with the help of a small funding award from the ESRC - have been busily facilitating a (participant-led) mapping of the spaces and places of homelessness in Newcastle-upon-Tyne. The outputs from this exercise were launched this week, via a touring exhibition around various hostels, day centres and public spaces across the city. The outputs are also being showcased on the following project blog - both in their 'discrete' form (individual maps) and in the context of a 'composite' map created by the artist Lovely Jojo. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-07T10:57:05+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Adele Irving</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;5f60829f.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;43eb4faf.1410">   <title>Housing - Critical Futures - Inaugural Call </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;43eb4faf.1410</link>   <description> Housing \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Critical Futures \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd an international program of conferences and events is launched for 2015-16.<br><br>AN OPEN CALL for two Inaugural Events:<br><br>CONFERENCE \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd OPEN CALL: http://architecturemps.com/housing-critical-perspective/ 08-09 April 2015<br><br>FILM SCREENINGS &amp; DEBATE: http://architecturemps.com/h-cfl-filmdebate/ 10 January 2015<br><br>EVENTS involve:<br><br>Patrick Keiler. Independent Filmmaker. Dilapidated Dwelling \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd film screening.<br>Avi Friedman. Architect / Housing Specialist. TBC. McGill University, Canada.<br>Loretta Lees. Human Geographer. University of Leicester<br>Luciana Berger, MP. Shadow Minister for Public Health, UK. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-29T17:26:51+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>James Matthews</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;43eb4faf.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;d1bdb831.1410">   <title>To a More Ambitious Place: The Glass-House Community Led Design Debate Series 2014/15 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;d1bdb831.1410</link>   <description> To a More Ambitious Place: The Glass-House Community Led Design Debate Series 2014/15<br><br>As we approach elections in the UK and a key moment in the future of politics in Scotland, we believe it is important that we keep place on the agenda and create a space for a dialogue between the different collaborators in placemaking. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-27T16:55:39+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Maja Luna Jorgensen</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;d1bdb831.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;d5929719.1410">   <title>Tackling health inequalities in private rented housing, 26th November 2014, London </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;d5929719.1410</link>   <description> *Apologies if you receive this email more than once*<br><br>*Tackling health inequalities in private rented housing<br>&lt;http://www.raceequalityfoundation.org.uk/training/events/tackling-health-inequalities-private-rented-housing&gt;*<br>26th November 2014, London<br>http://www.raceequalityfoundation.org.uk/training/events/tackling-health-inequalities-private-rented-housing<br><br>This event will bring together community, voluntary and public sector<br>action on private rented housing. It will identify and seek solutions to<br>health inequalities that affect private tenants, and their underlying<br>causes.<br><br>Nine million people now live in private rented housing. It is the fastest<br>growing housing sector in the UK and more people now live in private rented<br>housing than social housing. In London it is estimated to become the<br>largest housing sector by 2025, and nationally [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-27T16:45:58+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Kat Clayton</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;d5929719.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;7471e627.1410">   <title>CFP: Deconstructing \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdGeneration Rent\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd: Young People\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Housing Options and Future Welfare</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECHRN;7471e627.1410</link>   <description> With apologies for cross-posting, list members may be interested in either<br>attending or presenting at this seminar. It will identify and seek solutions to<br>health inequalities that affect private tenants, and their underlying<br>causes.<br><br>Nine million people now live in private rented housing. It is the fastest<br>growing housing sector in the UK and more people now live in private rented<br>housing than social housing. In London it is estimated to become the<br>largest housing sector by 2025, and nationally 20.8% of renters are<br>families with children.
